function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Psychological distance and construal level theory influencing perceived risk in tourism contexts may lead to inaccurate risk perceptions.","Impact":"Increased likelihood of tourists engaging in risky behaviors and not adhering to safety measures.","Mitigation":"Conducting research to verify the relationships among psychological constructs and their influences on tourists' behavioral patterns.","Technologies":"Research methodologies for exploring psychological constructs and their effects.","People":"Tourists, travelers","Owner":"Researchers, scholars"},{"Description":"Individuals' varying construal of psychological distance and COVID-19-related risk perceptions may lead to inconsistent travel willingness and preferences.","Impact":"Increased likelihood of travelers engaging in high-risk activities and exhibiting unpredictable travel behavior.","Mitigation":"Exploring the nuances of tourism segments to identify catalysts and inhibitors of specific psychological dimensions and perceived risk.","Technologies":"Data analysis tools for segmenting tourist preferences and behavior patterns.","People":"Tourists, travelers","Owner":"Tourism industry researchers, market analysts"},{"Description":"Dissemination of negative messages through social media may exacerbate country image problems and increase anxiety among tourists.","Impact":"Reduced tourism recovery and engagement due to negative perceptions of safety and country image.","Mitigation":"Monitoring and managing social media content to mitigate the impact of negative messages on tourists' perceptions.","Technologies":"Social media monitoring and sentiment analysis tools.","People":"Tourists, tourism industry, country representatives","Owner":"Social media management teams, tourism industry representatives"}]}
